intro: Clidemia capilliflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia capilliflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
